newsletters.title: Ellison Taking TikTok?

mainStories.headline: Oracle + TikTok + Paramount + WBD = ?
mainStories.summary: TikTok's getting a U.S. owner with Oracle leading the charge. Oracle, along with Silver Lake, Andreessen Horowitz, and other investors would take an 80% stake in a new U.S. TikTok entity. Larry Ellison controls 77.5% of National Amusements (owns Paramount) and his son David is preparing a mostly-cash bid for Warner Bros. Discovery.
keyPoints: Oracle shares got a bump from the TikTok news
Larry Ellison is building a vertically integrated media empire: cloud infrastructure (Oracle), social distribution (TikTok), content creation (Paramount + potentially WBD)
TikTok brings 136M U.S. users, with Gen Z spending 3+ hours daily on the platform
Both TikTok and potential Warner deal would need regulatory approval

mainStories.headline: Disney, Universal, WBD sue Chinese AI startup MiniMax
mainStories.summary: Disney, Universal, and Warner Bros. are suing $3B Chinese startup MiniMax for letting users create videos with Spider-Man, Darth Vader, and other protected characters through its Hailuo AI app. The studios call it an attack on America's creative community and $260B entertainment industry.
keyPoints: MiniMax is marketed as a 'Hollywood studio in your pocket'
The startup is pursuing an IPO while allegedly ignoring copyright law
Chinese companies are moving ahead with AI while Hollywood debates guardrails

business: Trump proposes ending quarterly earnings reports for U.S. companies, suggesting six-month reporting instead
Movie theaters dropped $1.5B on renovations as part of $2.2B pledge through 2027
Domestic box office sits at $6.22B for 2025, up 4.5% from last year but down 8.8% from 2023

film: Greenwich and Kanopy acquired U.S. rights to 'Reading Lolita in Tehran'
Row K Entertainment acquired 'Charlie Harper' starring Nick Robinson and Emilia Jones
Universal pushed 'Other Mommy' to October 9, 2026
Sarah Levy, Phillipa Soo, Adam Pally star in 'Run'
Tyrese Gibson and Deon Taylor reteaming for 'Don't Open the Door'

'The Morning Show' renewed for S5 at Apple TV+
'Tulsa King' renewed for S4 at Paramount+

notableQuotes: Robert Redford passed away peacefully at 89 in his Utah mountain home

industryData.emmysViewership: 7.4M viewers, up 8% from last year and most-watched since 2021

newsletters.title: Underdogs Win

mainStories.headline: 77th Emmy Awards - Underdogs triumph
mainStories.summary: First-time host Nate Bargatze presided over one of the most surprising Emmy nights in years, with underdogs beating heavy favorites across major categories. 'The Studio' broke records with 12 total awards, while 'Adolescence' swept Limited Series.
keyPoints: 'The Studio' ended with 12 total awards, breaking 'The Bear's single-season record
'Adolescence' swept Limited Series with 6 awards
'The Pitt' beat 'Severance' for Outstanding Drama despite 'Severance' having 27 nominations
Owen Cooper (15) became youngest male Emmy winner ever
'The Bear' went home empty-handed despite multiple nominations

mainStories.headline: Sean Astin elected SAG-AFTRA president
mainStories.summary: The 'Lord of the Rings' star won with 79% of the vote, taking over from Fran Drescher as the 160,000-member union prepares for 2026 negotiations with studios. Only 17% of members cast ballots, down from 26% when Drescher won in 2021.
keyPoints: Astin won with 79% of vote
Only 17% voter turnout vs 26% in 2021
Union leaning toward collaboration over confrontation
High-stakes 2026 negotiations upcoming

boxOffice.achievement: Best opening ever for anime, beating Pokémon's $31M record from 1999. 6th biggest September opening of all time.

business: SAG-AFTRA's 'Robin Hood fund' finally launching after two-year wait
Fund distributes streaming revenue to performers beyond A-listers
First time background actors, stand-ins, stunt riggers receive backend payments

film: Nintendo and Illumination set 'The Super Mario Galaxy Movie' for April 3, 2026
Lin Shaye and Amelia Eve star in next 'Insidious' movie for 2026
Netflix picked up 'South Pole Santa' with Colin Jost producing
tv: A24 closing in on 'Texas Chain Saw Massacre' film and TV rights
Ego Nwodim exiting 'SNL' after seven seasons
Netflix renewed 'The Hunting Wives' for S2

notableQuotes: Nate Bargatze pledged $100K to charity but deducted $1K for every second winners went over 45-second speech limit

industryData.weekendBoxOffice: $147.9M, up 36.7% from same weekend last year

newsletters.title: Paramount + WBD

mainStories.headline: Paramount wants Warner Bros. next
mainStories.summary: The Ellison family is preparing a majority-cash bid for Warner Bros. Discovery. The news sent WBD shares soaring 29%. Paramount wants the whole package despite WBD planning to split cable networks from streaming and studios by April 2026.
keyPoints: Would create $57B+ media giant (WBD's $39.8B + Paramount's $17.95B market caps)
Combined streaming could rival Netflix and Disney
Would unite DC Comics, Star Trek, Mission: Impossible, Harry Potter, Game of Thrones
Senator Elizabeth Warren called for deal to be blocked
Critics worry about creative impact - fewer studios mean fewer buyers

mainStories.headline: Production assistants on 'The Pitt' make Hollywood history
mainStories.summary: Support staffers on HBO Max's medical drama unanimously voted to unionize with LiUNA Local 724, reportedly becoming the first PAs on a major TV show to organize. They can now negotiate for health insurance, wage increases, and basic protections.
keyPoints: First PAs on major TV show to unionize
Production slowdowns have made PA jobs scarce
Many assistant directors stepping down to entry-level roles to find work
Union leaders call it 'only the beginning'

streaming.newRelease: The Paper - 9M hours streamed in week one (~1.9M season views)

business: New pharma ad rules could turn 30-second spots into 4-minute infomercials
Pharma spends $5B+ annually on TV ads
Netflix's 10-year exclusive holds expiring: 'House of Cards' loses exclusivity next year
'Orange Is the New Black' follows in 2029, 'Ozark' in 2032

film: Michelle Buteau and Zooey Deschanel star in 'Heather of the Valley'
Idris Elba to direct and star in Apple TV+'s 'This Is How It Goes'
Legendary paid seven figures for 'Alchemised' movie rights (began as Harry Potter fan fiction)

Francesca Sloane to write 'Big Little Lies' S3
'Foundation' renewed for S4 at Apple TV+

newsletters.title: $2M-a-day

mainStories.headline: The Sphere is a $2M-a-day movie theater
mainStories.summary: The Sphere's 'Wizard of Oz' draws 15,000 people daily at ~$200 a ticket, generating ~$2M per day. Films generate 2x more revenue than concerts ($400M vs $200M this year), with The Sphere keeping 70% profit margins on movies.
keyPoints: 'Wizard of Oz' likely to hit $1B in sales from single location
4M tickets already sold for 'Postcards From Earth'
MSG owner James Dolan sank $2.3B into building Sphere, $100M more for AI adaptation of 'Oz'
Warner Bros. gets pure profit from licensing while Sphere covered all costs
Spheres planned for Abu Dhabi and beyond
Dolan talking to studios about 'Harry Potter' and 'Star Wars'

mainStories.headline: OpenAI's making a movie
mainStories.summary: OpenAI is backing 'Critterz,' an animated feature aiming for theaters next year. The project attempts 9 months and under $30M instead of typical 3 years and $100M+ for animated films, using GPT-5 and image generation models.
keyPoints: 30-person team vs typical hundreds of animation professionals
Writers from 'Paddington in Peru' team writing script
Human voice actors being cast
Team hopes to debut at Cannes 2026
No distribution partner yet
This is what guilds warned about during 2023 strikes

business: James Wan might exit 'Conjuring' franchise over money - wants 25-50% cut vs WB refusing
Paramount hired ombudsman for CBS News after $16M Trump settlement
YouTube's NFL game hit 17.3M viewers but competitors questioned Nielsen measurement methods
Lachlan Murdoch cemented control of family empire after siblings cashed out for $3.3B

film: David F. Sandberg directing Amazon MGM's 'Amityville Horror' reimagining
Benny Safdie and Dwayne Johnson reunite for 'Lizard Music'
Cate Blanchett starring in 'Sweetsick' at Searchlight
Lionsgate developing 'The Last Witch Hunter' sequel with Vin Diesel

James Corden and Ruth Jones star in Apple TV+ comedy-drama 'The Choir'
Charlie Brooker making untitled four-part Netflix detective thriller

newsletters.title: WB's Hot Streak 🔥

mainStories.headline: Warner Bros. makes it 7 straight
mainStories.summary: 'The Conjuring: Last Rites' turned a $55M budget into an $83M domestic opening and $187M globally. Third-biggest domestic horror opening ever and biggest horror opening overseas ever with $104M international.
keyPoints: Warner Bros. has seven straight $40M+ openings this year - no other studio has managed this
Conjuring universe has crossed $2.5B worldwide on combined budget of just $263M
Horror represents 15% of all ticket sales this year as third-biggest genre
Overall box office hit $124M this weekend, up from $65M last weekend

mainStories.headline: TIFF hits midpoint - marketplace evolves
mainStories.summary: Toronto International Film Festival is testing unofficial market ahead of first official content market next year (backed by $23M CAD government funding). Fewer splashy packages, more finished films with campaign-ready materials.
keyPoints: Focus Features in talks to acquire 'Obsession' for $15M+
Black Bear announced they will distribute Sydney Sweeney's 'Christy' in November
Streamers have slashed Pay-1 and Pay-2 licensing fees
Two well-capitalized newcomers (Black Bear, Row K) actively buying

boxOffice.achievement: Third-biggest domestic horror opening ever, biggest horror opening overseas ever ($104M)

boxOffice.note: Five-year-old filmed stage show at ~$5,500 per screen

business: Entertainment industry shed 7,600 jobs in August
Total employment dropped to 401,000
Authors won largest copyright payout ever: Anthropic settled for $1.5B
NFL claims Nielsen undercounting audiences by tens of millions

film: Tiffany Haddish and Isla Fisher star in 'Double Crossed'
Paramount acquired James Vanderbilt's untitled techno-thriller
Djimon Hounsou joined 'Highlander' remake with Henry Cavill
Snoop Dogg and Eli Roth teaming on 'Don't Go In That House, Bitch!'
tv: Piers Morgan returning to U.K. TV on Paramount's Channel 5

notableQuotes: Amazon-backed Showrunner attempting to resurrect Orson Welles' lost 'The Magnificent Ambersons' footage using AI

newsletters.title: Gamer CEO

mainStories.headline: A gamer CEO just greenlit Call of Duty
mainStories.summary: Paramount and Activision struck a deal to bring Call of Duty to the big screen. The franchise has sold 500M copies across 23 mainline titles and topped US sales charts for 16 straight years. CEO David Ellison actually plays COD and promises 'Top Gun: Maverick'-level commitment.
keyPoints: First major IP play since Skydance merger
Activision tried in 2015 and 2018 but projects never materialized
Recent video game successes: Super Mario Bros. ($1.3B), Sonic franchise ($1B), Minecraft ($950M)
Gen Alpha wants to go to theaters but cares about digital-first properties and video games
Joins 'Street Fighter,' 'Metal Gear Solid,' 'Elden Ring' in development

mainStories.headline: CBS News potentially buying The Free Press
mainStories.summary: Paramount CEO David Ellison reportedly close to buying Bari Weiss's The Free Press for $100-200M and giving her a major role at CBS News. Bold bet to reinvent struggling news division with personality-driven approach.
keyPoints: Weiss left NYT in 2020 over ideological clashes
Built The Free Press on Substack into major platform
Would challenge traditional network news conventions
Major changes expected for former Walter Cronkite network

TikTok teamed with Fandango for direct in-app movie ticket purchasing
TIFF kicked off with official market launching next year
Paramount and Legendary closed three-year global distribution deal starting with 'Street Fighter'

film: Emily Blunt to star in and produce 'Walk the Blue Fields'
Sam Raimi and Roy Lee producing Lionsgate remake of 'Magic' (1978)
Alan Ritchson starring as Navy SEAL Mike Thornton for Amazon MGM

John C. McGinley reprising Dr. Cox in ABC's 'Scrubs' reboot

newsletters.title: That's Summer

mainStories.headline: Summer 2025 box office wraps at $3.67B
mainStories.summary: Summer 2025 was essentially flat with summer 2024's $3.68B, down 10% from 2023's 'Barbenheimer'-fueled $4.09B. The $4B milestone has only been hit once in past 5 years. Despite this, attendance increased by 1M to 275M admissions.
keyPoints: May started strong (up 76% vs May 2024) but lost momentum
11 films hit $100M (up from 9 last year) - more evenly distributed
International box office revenue dropped significantly - ratio flipped to 50-70% domestic
Only 3 of 2025's top 10 films earned 60%+ overseas vs 8 in 2019
Local content dominating in international markets
China announced plan to 'moderately reduce' U.S. releases

mainStories.headline: Gen Alpha actually prefers movie theaters
mainStories.summary: NRG study shows 59% of Gen Alpha (kids 12 and under) prefer big screen over couch, compared to just 45% of Millennials. This generation sees theaters as escape from screen-saturated lives.
keyPoints: 55% prefer going with large friend groups vs 31% of Millennials
Over 60% want to see new movies on opening weekend
68% say spending time with friends/family is major reason
54% interested in 3D/VR experiences
Top franchises: Roblox, Minecraft, Fortnite - social gaming platforms
Netflix putting 'KPop Demon Hunters' in theaters for $20M two-day gross

business: Labor Day weekend: $63.6M 3-day / $83M 4-day, down 25% from last year
Warner Bros. moved 'Mortal Kombat II' from October to May 2026
YTD box office through August: $5.88B (up 5% year-over-year)

film: Channing Tatum, Oscar Isaac, Zazie Beetz star in 'Kockroach'
Disney scrapped Questlove's 'The Aristocats' live-action remake
Amazon MGM picked up Morgan Neville's Paul McCartney doc 'Man on the Run'
tv: Warwick Davis reprising Professor Flitwick in HBO's 'Harry Potter' series (2027)
Prime Video canceled 'Motorheads' after S1
Prime Video ordered 'The Chosen Adventures' animated series

notableQuotes: Lionsgate swapped seats with treadmills for 'The Long Walk' screening

newsletters.title: Hail Mary

mainStories.headline: NBC using NFL as lifeline for late-night TV
mainStories.summary: NBC is piggybacking Jimmy Fallon onto 'Sunday Night Football' broadcasts this fall, airing special episodes after four NFL games to leverage the 21.6M viewers. CBS canceled Colbert's 'Late Show' due to financial losses, and NBC acknowledges both Fallon and Meyers face eroding viewership and shrinking ad revenue.
keyPoints: Targeting high-profile games including two Chiefs matchups (Travis Kelce/Taylor Swift engagement)
Last year's post-SNF 'Tonight Show' scored Fallon's best ratings of season
Both Fallon and Meyers locked in through 2028
NBC building Fallon's brand beyond late-night
'Password' renewed for S3 after reaching 32M viewers
Launching 'On Brand with Jimmy Fallon' this fall

mainStories.headline: California awards $256M in tax credits
mainStories.summary: The state awarded $255.7M to 22 TV productions including 'The Studio,' 'Presumed Innocent,' and 'NCIS: Origins' in first round since expanding incentive program from $330M to $750M. Applications jumped nearly 400% compared to last year.
keyPoints: Program opened to half-hour shows for first time
Untitled Dan Fogelman Hulu drama scored biggest allocation at $42.8M
Should generate ~$1.1B in economic activity
Create work for 6,500 cast and crew members across state

The Map That Leads To You

'Taskmaster' skipping US networks, releasing S20 in full on YouTube
Warner Bros. named Brad Singer as CFO ahead of 2026 post-split launch
Peacock launching on Prime Video Channels at $16.99/month

film: Todd Haynes' 'De Noche' revived with Pedro Pascal circling to star
Lucasfilm set cast for 'Star Wars: Starfighter' - Amy Adams, Aaron Pierre join Ryan Gosling

newsletters.title: Fall Festival Season is Here

mainStories.headline: Venice kicks off fall festival season
mainStories.summary: The 82nd Venice Film Festival kicks off the industry's most crucial period for positioning Oscar contenders. Venice programs exclusively world premieres that travel the entire festival circuit. After Cannes dominated last season (31 Oscar noms vs Venice's 17), Venice is poised for comeback with stronger lineup.
keyPoints: Netflix back with 3 major titles after sitting out 2024: del Toro's 'Frankenstein,' Bigelow's 'A House of Dynamite,' Baumbach's 'Jay Kelly'
'The Smashing Machine' - Dwayne Johnson's dramatic Venice debut
Julia Roberts' Lido debut in 'After the Hunt'
No official marketplace like Cannes or Berlin - deals happen quietly in hotel suites
Many anticipated titles skip Venice for Telluride/TIFF

mainStories.headline: Your entire digital library is a rental in disguise
mainStories.summary: Amazon facing class action lawsuit over Prime Video's 'Buy' buttons - customers actually just get revocable licenses. California's Assembly Bill 2426 (effective this year) prohibits advertising digital goods as 'purchases' unless buyers get unrestricted ownership.
keyPoints: Amazon and Apple both defended similar allegations in 2020
Amazon buries license disclosure in tiny print at bottom of confirmation pages
Christopher Nolan and Guillermo del Toro have championed physical media ownership
Lawsuit seeks all profits from fake 'purchases' plus extra damages

business: Netflix won bidding war for Nic Pizzolatto/Matthew McConaughey/Cole Hauser series
Anthropic settled with authors who accused AI company of illegally downloading 7M books
YouTube topped TV viewership for 6th straight month - 13.4% of all U.S. TV watching
Fox channels could disappear from YouTube TV (deadlocked over fees)

film: Universal developing 'Knight Rider' movie with 'Cobra Kai' creators
Sony and Netflix in talks for 'KPop Demon Hunters 2' sequel
The Forge acquired Kristen Stewart's directorial debut 'The Chronology of Water'
Emma Roberts starring in rom-com murder mystery 'A Murder Uncorked'
tv: Annette Bening starring in 'Yellowstone' spinoff 'The Dutton Ranch'
Netflix renewed 'Trainwreck' documentary franchise for S2
Hulu ordered Alex Gibney doc on Luigi Mangione
Prime Video developing 'Dorothy' - contemporary Wizard of Oz series

notableQuotes: Vulture launched Movies Fantasy League - draft movies instead of players, score points through Oscar night

newsletters.title: Spec Boom?

mainStories.headline: Netflix gets first box office win
mainStories.summary: 'KPop Demon Hunters Sing-Along' earned $18M+ from just 1,700 theaters over two days for Netflix's first-ever #1 box office win. Already the streamer's second-most-watched title with 210M+ views. Families paid premium prices to rewatch what they'd already seen at home.
keyPoints: Packed houses full of kids singing along
Billboard-charting songs
Calculated experiment with proven winner that required zero marketing spend
Sing-along version hit Netflix same day
A24's 'Ne Zha 2' tanked with just $1.5M on 2,200+ screens despite Michelle Yeoh voice

mainStories.headline: Spec script market suddenly hot again
mainStories.summary: 8 spec deals closed in August 2025 alone - highest monthly total since March 2017. Spec market hit rock bottom with just 11 deals in all of 2023. During '90s golden era, Hollywood averaged 12-13 deals per month. 2025 has 19 total deals so far.
keyPoints: 'With The 8th Pick' - Kobe Bryant NBA draft drama to Warner Bros.
'Bald Eagles' - seven figures preemptive deal at Paramount
'The Pirate' - Amazon MGM with Jason Momoa attached
'Incidents' - 11-studio bidding war, Searchlight won
'The Survival List' - Lionsgate with Blake Lively attached
TV pilot market has dried up, pushing writers toward features

mainStories.headline: Netflix posts AI dos and don'ts
mainStories.summary: Netflix published AI guidelines for production partners with five core rules. CEO Ted Sarandos highlighted 'The Eternaut' used AI to create building collapse sequence 10x faster than traditional VFX, keeping show within budget.
keyPoints: Don't copy others' copyrighted work
Protect Netflix content from AI training
Use secure enterprise-approved AI platforms
Final output needs approval
Respect union rules - can't replace actors/crew without consent
Netflix caught flak for using AI-generated photos in 'What Jennifer Did' documentary

business: Fed Chair Powell hinted at September rate cuts - media stocks jumped
Paramount cutting 2,500-3,000 jobs in November seeking $2B+ cost savings
Jeffrey Katzenberg joins Kimbal Musk's Nova Sky Stories as investor/board member

film: Tommy Dorfman developing 'Detransition, Baby' feature
Vera Farmiga starring opposite Mark Wahlberg in Apple film
Will Ferrell, America Ferrera, Natalie Portman voice Neon's 'Arco'
Paramount acquired Trevor Noah's 'The Island' pitch
tv: ABC developing legal drama 'The Advocate'
Paramount pulled plug on 'Dexter: Original Sin' S2 despite earlier renewal
MGM+ renewed Stephen King's 'The Institute' for S2

notableQuotes: IFC upgraded 'Good Boy' dog POV horror to wide release after 2,000% search spike for 'does the dog die'

industryData.specScriptDeals: 8 in August 2025 (highest since March 2017), 19 total in 2025 so far vs 11 in all of 2023
industryData.weekendBoxOffice: $77M, down 13% from same weekend last year

newsletters.title: Embracing the Scroll

mainStories.headline: ESPN and Fox embrace the scroll
mainStories.summary: ESPN and Fox launched separate streaming apps (same day) - first time full cable content available outside cable. Both pack in TikTok-style vertical video feeds. Apps chase 65M 'cord-never' households.
keyPoints: ESPN: $29.99/month, Fox: $19.99/month
Joint bundle for $39.99 starting October
Current cable subscribers get apps free
ESPN hired social media stars like Katie Feeney and Omar Raja as full-time talent
ESPN syncs phone to TV game for stats, fantasy updates, betting lines
ESPN's cable subscribers dropped from 100M (2011) to 61M today

mainStories.headline: Talent reps using AI to negotiate deals
mainStories.summary: Hollywood agents using AI tools like ChatGPT and Grok to quantify social media buzz and prove how much clients drive viewership. Priyanka Chopra Jonas's team used AI to show she generated 50-60% of online conversation for 'Heads of State' despite being third-billed.
keyPoints: Pre-streaming era had clear box office/Nielsen ratings
Streamers keep viewership data mostly to themselves
Social metrics now give agents concrete leverage in negotiations

mainStories.headline: Disney ditching franchises to lure Gen Z men
mainStories.summary: Despite dominating box office, Disney faces threat: superhero movies and franchise reboots aren't capturing males aged 13-28. Disney actively seeking pitches for original concepts (globe-trotting adventures, treasure hunts) instead of relying on IP library.
keyPoints: Gaming-obsessed generation didn't grow up on Disney classics
Doesn't respond to franchises like millennials do
Big shift for company that built empire on recycling beloved properties

streaming.performance: 2.1M season views, 10.4M hours in first week

Phil Lord/Christopher Miller producing Universal 'Archie' adaptation

tv: Andrew Haigh writing/directing Keith Haring TV series
Dominic West and Sienna Miller lead Sky/HBO legal thriller 'War'
Nicolas Cage in talks for 'True Detective' S5 in New York

newsletters.title: New Name, Who Dis?

mainStories.headline: MSNBC becomes MS NOW
mainStories.summary: MSNBC getting new name and losing peacock as part of NBCUniversal's spinoff of cable properties into new company called Versant. MS NOW stands for 'My Source News Opinion World.' Rebrand aims to end brand confusion between MSNBC's progressive opinion journalism and NBC News's neutral editorial tone.
keyPoints: Peacock logo stays with NBCUniversal, forcing all spun-off channels to rebrand
MSNBC on hiring spree - poached NBC's Jacob Soboroff and Vaughn Hillyard
Other Versant channels get minor tweaks
Internet mocked clunky rebrand - sounds like MS fundraiser or Windows OS
Full transition by year's end when Versant launches

mainStories.headline: Marvel leaving Georgia for UK era
mainStories.summary: Marvel ditching Georgia after a decade. 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' was studio's first UK production, next two 'Avengers' films and 'Spider-Man' following. Georgia production spending dropped 50% in past three years.
keyPoints: After making 22+ projects in Atlanta
UK has similar tax credits (~30%) but way cheaper labor
British crews don't need employer-covered health insurance
In 2024, big-budget US productions down 29% from 2022
UK saw 16% growth in same period
Trilith Studios near Atlanta now sits largely empty

mainStories.headline: Mark Rober lands Netflix deal
mainStories.summary: Netflix partnered with YouTube creator/former NASA engineer Mark Rober to develop family-friendly competition series premiering 2026. Will blend science education with entertainment, tapping into his 70M YouTube subscribers. Netflix will also license some existing YouTube episodes.
keyPoints: Kimmelot (Jimmy Kimmel's banner) producing
Latest in growing creator-to-streamer pipeline
Platforms betting on YouTube stars who bring built-in fans

business: Paramount wants to be Legendary's new distributor (excluding China)
Deal would help Paramount hit 15-20 films/year goal
Nexstar buying rival Tegna for $6.2B - 265-station network covering 80% of U.S. households
California handed out first batch of TV tax credits since $750M boost

Kevin Costner and Jake Gyllenhaal star in Amazon MGM's 'Honeymoon with Harry'

Ben Stiller won't direct 'Severance' S3 - focusing on war film
Apple picked up pickleball comedy 'The Dink' with Jake Johnson/Ben Stiller
Netflix renewed crime drama 'Dept. Q' for S2
